meanings.definition: The quality of being salty or having a taste like salt.
meanings.sent1: I could taste the brininess of the sea in the air.
meanings.sent2: The soup had a hint of brininess from the added salt.
meanings.sent3: The brininess of the chips made them irresistible.
meanings.sent4: Her tears carried the brininess of heartache.
meanings.sent5: The brininess of the ocean lingered on my lips long after swimming.

meanings.definition: The presence of salt in something, especially water or food.
meanings.sent1: The brininess of the ocean water stung my eyes.
meanings.sent2: The chef adjusted the dish's brininess by adding more salt.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected brininess of the dessert caught me by surprise.
meanings.sent4: The brininess of the air near the salt flats was palpable.
meanings.sent5: The brininess of the pickles made my mouth water.
